Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy new TUDA head.description: TIRUPATI: Chandragiri YSRC legislator Dr Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy took charge as the chairman of Tirupati urban development authority (TUDA) on Sunday. Tirupati MLA Bhumana Karunakar Reddy felicitated the new chairman and appealed to him to strive for the overall development of TUDA. The new chairman vowed to preserve the sanctity of the temple city in line with the sentiments of the visiting devotees and the locals alike. ‘‘Our top priority will be to provide clean water to all. We have a vision document and we will deliver the best of services to the citizens in a transparent manner,” he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Downsizing of liquor shops not to affect.description: VIJAYAWADA: Even as the government is mulling to downsize the number of wine shops by 20% across the state as a first step in achieving prohibition, excise revenue is likely to be unaffected in the first year. As the government is considering to increase liquor prices to make it unaffordable, margin on liquor sales is likely to be increased compensating the corresponding losses in volumes, according to reliable sources in the excise department. The state government is earning nearly Rs 7,000 crore revenue on liquor sales with an average 16 per cent year-on-year growth. There are about 4,402 wine shops and 826 bars across the state which do retail liquor sales. On the other hand, each wine shop is having eight to 10 belt shops which do illegal sales of liquor especially in rural and sub-urban areas. Now with the new government taking the decision to eradicate all belt shops and also to downsize the number of liquor outlets, the sales volumes are likely to get affected. However, this reduction in number of shops may not affect revenues in the first year, said a senior official on condition of anonymity. As the liquor policy is likely to be tweaked every year to downsize the number of outlets to impose complete liquor ban in next five years, revenues will come down from the second year. The increase in liquor prices, however, will give a one-year window for the government to compensate revenue loss and look for alternative sources. On the other hand, many liquor shop owners are also looking to come out of the trade as the state government’s decision is not favourable to them as they expect tighter norms in the upcoming policy. With the reduction of margins in the previous policy, many of them had ended up in losses. Some who are in the trade for long are also not interested this time to participate in the bidding, said Y Srikanth who runs a bar in Vijayawada. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Farmers suffer at the cost of illegal se.description: Guntur: Notwithstanding the delayed monsoon pushing agriculture activities on to back foot, illegal seed processing units are working overtime to make the most from the anxiety of farmers. Thanks to tacit support from senior officials in agriculture department, fraudsters are packing spurious seeds for marketing. The vigilance and enforcement department have sealed two illegal seed processing units operating for the past two years in Guntur city. “It is not possible for fraudsters to continue operations without support from top officials in the agriculture department,” said a vigilance and enforcement official. The agriculture department has not carried out mandatory inspections in processing units despite knowing that many plants are flouting the norms. Sources said the department is turning a blind eye to unethical operations of seed processing units, seed manufacturing units and fake pesticide firms. As per rules, the processing units should collect seed only from recognized seed research and testing laboratories. The seed readied by scientists should carry a lot number, scientist name and seed variety. The processing centre should maintain records with all details before handing them over to farmers. The unit should have details of the farmer so that the agriculture department carries out germination tests in the field. The seed will be allowed to market only after successful completion of germination test. Many processing units do not procure breeders and set up in the unit, which is mandatory to run the operations. With no official visiting the plants, processing units are marketing unauthorized and untested seeds. Sources said processing units are procuring old and expired seeds from seed firms and sell them to farmers after processing. The seeds are packed in bags carrying unauthorized logos and brand names to lure farmers. There are allegations about officials in the agriculture department receiving money to let illegal seed processing units to continue. Seed processing units have a turnover not less than Rs 50 crore and it is alleged that the ‘share’ of certain department officials is around Rs 2 to Rs 5 crore. The officials and processing units blame farmers in case they lodge complaints of poor germination, saying the growers did not follow the guidelines to get best results. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Rowdy-sheeter stabbed to death in Vijaya.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 32-year-old rowdy-sheeter was stabbed to death by two persons on CVR flyover in Vijayawada on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. The deceased, identified as Kilari Suresh, was a native of Chitti Nagar. According to Mohammed Umar, inspector of Two Town police station, the murder was carried out around midnight. Suresh stopped an auto on CVR flyover and demanded money from the driver and his friend (who also is an auto driver by vocation). As the two men refused to give him money, Suresh took out a knife and threatened to attack them. Police said that all the three men involved in the incident were in an inebriated state. As Suresh threatened the two friends with his knife, the auto drivers retaliated and attacked him. They snatched the knife from Suresh’s hand and inflicted deep gashes upon him with the knife. Suresh died on the spot with heavy bleeding. Upon knowing about the incident, cops rushed to the spot and shifted the body to a government hospital. Suresh was a habitual offender and drinker. He often used threats to extort money in an inebriated state at Wynchpet and Chitti Nagar areas. He has a rowdy sheet against him at Two Town police station and many pending cases. On the other hand, the auto drivers are said to be natives of YSRC Colony and they do not have any criminal background, according to police sources. Cops are yet to make arrests in the case. Real estate agent killed in Tirupati.description: TIRUPATI: A real estate agent was murdered by unidentified men at Adoni town in Kurnool district on Sunday night. According to reports, the real estate agent was burned to death. According to Adoni sub inspector, Ramanjaneyulu, the deceased, 43-year-old Basavaraj owns a barber shop and also operates as a real estate agent. On Sunday, Basavaraj was reportedly taken away by some unidentified men, in the pretext of offering alcohol. “They took the deceased to the Maremma Guddi area where all of them consumed liquor. However in the morning, Basavaraju was found dead at the spot. The micreants reportedly burned him to death,” the sub inspector said. Upon receiving information, the Adoni police rushed to the crime scene and shifted the body of the deceased to a local government hospital for post-mortem. The police are on lookout for the accused.tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Will revamp Arogya Sri scheme, says Nani.description: Amaravati: Deputy chief minister in-charge of medical and health ministry, Alla Kalikrishna Srinivas (Nani) assumed charge at the secretariat on Monday. Speaking on the occasion, Nani said that making Andhra Pradesh a healthy state is as the top of the state government’s agenda. The deputy chief minister further said that the ‘Arogya Sri’ scheme will be completely revamped to help people. Every disease whose treatment costs more than Rs 1,000 will be included in the Arogya Sri package, he said. Addressing the media, Nani said that the TDP government had grossly neglected the scheme, causing suffering to the common people. He further alleged that the TDP government did not even clear the bills to hospitals, prompting them to refuse patients. “CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy was extremely pained at the death of infants in a government hospital in Ananthapuram. The incident was a result of the neglect of the TDP government,” the deputy chief minister said. Nani added that they have inspected the Ananthapuram hospital and would soon submit a report to the CM. Nani alleged that the TDP government had done nothing to improve health services except changing the name of the scheme to NTR Arogya Seva. Interestingly, the first file that the minister signed was to change the name of the scheme to YSR Arogya Sri. Nani assured that the government would soon begin the disbursement of Rs 10,000 pension to kidney patients. Meanwhile, women and child welfare minister Taneti Vanitha who also took charge as the secretariat on Sunday said and said that the CM has directed officials to not spare anyone indulging in crimes against women and children. The minister also cleared a file pertaining to increase of wages to Anganwadi workers. tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ammavodi cash to harm govt schools, fear.description: VIJAYAWADA: Some schools in the state have already started to advertise about the Rs 15,000 benefit under the state government’s Ammavodi scheme even before the government has finalised it. The state government has announced that monetary benefit under Ammavodi will be extended to all parents who were sending their children to school whether it is a private or a government school. However, detailed guidelines of the scheme are yet to be formulated and notified. While private school managements are upbeat over the new scheme and hope that this will be attractive to parents and would increase student strength, experts and student organisations are expressing concerns over the scheme. PDF MLC KS Lakshman Rao said that the scheme in its present form will be disadvantageous to government schools in the state. He fears that if parents get benefit to support their children’s education, everyone might send their wards to private schools. “The government should give the benefit to only those who send their children to government schools,” said Lakshman Rao. State general secretary of Progressive Democratic Students Union (PDSU) A Ravi Chandra fears that the scheme in its present form will hasten the privatisation of education in the state. “The first causalties of the scheme will be the 8,000 government schools running with single teacher,” he said. Requests have been pouring in to the offices of education minister A Suresh and government advisor Ajeya Kallam to change the scheme to limit the benefit only to government schools. Andhra Pradesh: 39,000 take test for for.description: TIRUPATI: As many as 39,123 candidates appeared for the screening tests for forest beat officers on Sunday. The tests were held across 13 districts by the the Andhra Pradesh public service commission (APPSC). After the APPSC had released notifications for recruitment to the posts of forest beat officers and assistant beat officers, as many as 70,139 candidates had applied for the posts. However, only 45,694 candidates downloaded the hall tickets, and an even lower number— 39123 appeared for the screening tests. The number amounts to 85.61% of the candidates who downloaded hall tickets. The test was held at 161 centres. Visakhapatnam topped the chart with 5,565 candidates appearing for the screening tests on Sunday, while only 1,464 candidates appeared for the tests in West Godavari. Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy to.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy has accepted his Telangana counterpart K Chandrasekhar Rao’s invitation to attend the inauguration of the Kaleswaram Project on June 21. On Monday, KCR met Jaganmohan Reddy at the latter’s Tadepalli residence to invite him. The two chief ministers discussed issues like inter-state river water, irrigation projects on Krishna and Godavari rivers, distribution of the institutions in the Schedule IX and X of the AP Reorganisation Act apart from other issues concerning both states. It is said that the two chief ministers have agreed to solve problems related to sharing of Krishna and Godavari waters and the projects proposed by the two states on the rivers without going to river water dispute tribunals. The chief ministers have decided to convene a meeting of chief secretaries of AP and Telangana on June 24. The secretaries, engineers and other senior officials of the water resources department would also be present in this meeting to resolve the inter-state water issues. Sources said KCR and Jagan had an initial talk about taking up a combined lift irrigation project on the Godavari to pump water into Nagarjuna Sagar reservoir. This would help both states to share the Godavari water from this reservoir. The Kaleswaram Project will benefit Guntur and Prakasam districts through Nagarjuna Sagar right canal. The CMs also spoke about taking up a combined lift irrigation project. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In Prakasam, people desert villages for.description: ONGOLE: With no sign of rain, situation has worsened in the western parts of drought-hit Prakasam district. Thousands of families are deserting the villages. Hundreds of deep borewells have gone completely dry leaving no water to be tapped. According to unofficial reports, at least 24 villages in Yerragondapalem, Kanigiri, Giddalur and Markapuram constituencies have been deserted. This is the fourth consecutive year that Prakasam district is witnessing a severe drought. The rural water supply department (RWS), transporting water to the crisis-hit villages, has been struggling to meet the ever-increasing demand for water. Prakasam district singularly is taking up nearly 10,000 trips of water tanks each day of the 22,000 trips being supplied by the water supply department for the entire state. Sources said that RWS officials supplied over 7,500 trips per day to the area in April and upped the scale of supplies to 9,400 by May. They thought that the situation might ease down by June. However, it was not to be. The attempts of the RWS to revive the borewells have also gone in vain as water could not be tapped even at the depth of 1,000ft. Sources in the RWS say that they would not be able to continue the supply by tankers for long. “In fact, it has become very difficult to supply 1,000 trips per day to each assembly constituency,” said a senior RWS official. “Leaving the village is the only way to survive now,” said Pedda Venkateswarlu of Karumanupalle village of Tarlubadu mandal. Even villages located on the banks of Nagarjunasagar branch canal are facing acute drinking water crisis. It was, for example, considered that Podili mandal had ample reserves of drinking water. But even here, the borewells have all dried up this year. The cattle are the worst-hit and farmers are being forced to sell away their animals due to the shortage of water and fodder. Education minister and legislator of Yerragondapalem Adimulapu Suresh has words of promise to offer though. “We will make an assessment of the situation and seek additional funds from the CM to manage the situation,” he said. Minister reviews progress of Kanaka Durg.description: VIJAYAWADA: The deadline for completion of the Kanaka Durga flyover has been extended till December 31. Since the start of works, this is the fifth deadline that has been set for the completion of the Rs 500 crore project. The Kanaka Durga flyover will maintain traffic flow on the western side of the city and also on National Highway 65. Citizens must brace for traffic curbs again as officials are planning to stop vehicular traffic for at least a month to complete the works. Minister for roads and buildings Dharmana Krishna Das inspected the flyover works on Saturday with endowments minister Vellampalli Srinivas and Vijayawada Central MLA Malladi Vishnu. Krishna Das reiterated that completion of the Kanaka Durga flyover will be taken up on top priority. “If people support us, the works will be completed by end of the year. We want to give the flyover as a new year’s gift to the people of Vijayawada,” he said. Endowments minister Vallampalli Srinivas found fault with the previous government for failing to complete the flyover works. He said the previous government lacked commitment. “Local TDP leaders only made tall claims but could not complete the works. We are going to complete the flyover works in a time-bound manner,” the minister said. MT Krishna Babu, principal secretary of roads and buildings department, said that 85% of the works have been completed so far. The construction company was asked to complete the works in three and a half years in the tender and later told to complete the works within a year. “Because of the company’s internal issues and other problems, they could not complete the works,” Krishna Babu said. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Don\u2019t adjust govt benefits against.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy on Tuesday told bankers not to adjust any financial benefit that the government extends to people against their loans. Addressing his first meeting with bankers at the State Level Bankers Committee (SLBC) on Tuesday, the CM said he had promised financial assistance to farmers, self-help group women and mothers for sending children to schools. These funds will be credited into bank accounts of beneficiaries, he said and asked them release the funds to beneficiaries. He asked the bankers not to harass women and farmers to repay their loans. He said the previous government had promised to waive their loans and made them defaulters. “Give them time to repay their loans. But don’t try to adjust government funds against their loans,” the CM said. Jagan said farmers’ loans have gone up from Rs 87,612 crore in 2014 to Rs 1,49,264 in 2019 as the government did not waive them and farmers could not pay. Similarly, total loans of SHG women have gone up from Rs 14,204 crore to Rs 27,451 crore in 2014. He asked the bankers not to insist on repayment and give them time. The bankers told the CM that they have set Rs 1,01,564 crore credit target for 2018-19 and had advanced Rs 1,06,560 crore. Rs 1,15,000 crore is the target for 2019-20, they said, adding that they would meet the target. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

K Raghupathi elected deputy speaker.description: VIJAYAWADA: The assembly unanimously elected Bapatla MLA Kona Raghupathi as deputy speaker on Tuesday. He is a second-time legislator from the ruling YSRC. His candidature was supported by ministers Peddireddi Ramachandra Reddy, Botsa Satyanarayana, Mekathoti Sucharitha, Kodali Srivenkateswara Rao and others. Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy and leader of opposition N Chandrababu Naidu, besides others accompanied Raghupathi to the speaker’s chair as speaker Thammineni Sitharam welcomed his new deputy. Ministers and members of the Assembly greeted the new deputy speaker on his  and expressed confidence that he would run the House successfully and impartially like his father, the late Kona Prabhakara Rao, who served as speaker in 1980-81. He was elected to the assembly from Bapatla constituency for three consecutive terms from 1967. Kona Prabhakara Rao was a minister in the Bhavanam Venkatram and Kotla Vijayabhaskara Reddy’s governments. Later, he served as governor of Pondicherry, Sikkim and Maharashtra. Kona Raghupathi entered politics in 2014 and elected to the Assembly on an YSRC ticket. He remained with YSRC though there were pressures from the then ruling TDP to switchover. Jaganmohan Reddy has rewarded Raghupathi’s loyalty with the deputy speaker post. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Prove irrigation project irregularities,.description: VIJAYAWADA: TDP questioned the new government’s priorities in the assembly on Monday. The opposition party alleged that the governor’s speech did not include key topics such as Amaravati development, Polavaram Project and industrial policy. Both Houses of the legislature have begun the debate on the motion thanking governor ESL Narasimhan for his address on June 14. In the assembly, government whip Budi Mutyala Naidu moved the motion, seconded by Kakani Govardhan Reddy. They said the government headed by Y S Jaganmohan Reddy is giving priority to neglected sections and farmers. They accused the TDP government of indulging in heavy corruption in Polavaram Project and Pattiseema lift irrigation scheme. TDP leader K Atchannaidu found fault with the governor not acknowledging development in the last five years. He questioned the government for not making any mention of Amaravati and Polavaram Project. He welcomed the ruling party’s decision to order probe into irrigation projects and asked them to prove the charges. He dared them to stop Pattiseema scheme, if YSRC found it useless as some members claimed. “If you think Pattiseema is a wasteful project, I would advise you to stop pumping water from the scheme for this season and see what the farmers would say,” Atchannaidu said. He found fault with the government handing over some buildings of AP to Telangana, without settling the institutions listed in Schedule IX and X of the AP Reorganisation Act. He also wanted the government to check with the energy department and ensure there are no power cuts in the state. Finance minister Buggana Rajendranath Reddy blamed the TDP government for not getting funds from the central government or get Schedule IX and X institutions bifurcated in the last four years when the TDP was in alliance with BJP. On developmental issues, the minister said the TDP government had utilised the spillover funds from the 13th finance commission, full funds from the 14th finance commission and funds from MNREGS. “Whatever was spent from these funds had gone mostly to Janma Bhoomi committees ignoring the elected gram panchayat sarpanches and ward members,” the minister said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Telugu family of 4 found dead in US.description: Vijayawada: Mystery shrouds the death of four members of a Telugu family who were shot and killed at their home in West Des Moines city, Iowa in the US on Saturday. Sunkara Chandrasekhar, 44, his wife Lavanya, 41, and their two sons aged 15 and 10, were shot and killed, a police statement said. The family was originally from Tsundur town in Andhra Pradesh’s Guntur district and were living in the US for at least the past two decades. On Saturday at around 10 am, a local resident contacted the emergency number 911 after being informed about gun shots being heard in Chandrasekhar’s house. Police officials, who rushed to the spot, found the four lying dead with gunshot wounds. Sources close to the family said that they had moved into the house only in March. Speaking to TOI, a family friend who is also a member of Telugu Association of North America (TANA) said on condition of anonymity that Chandrasekhar has been suffering from depression for a while and that there might have been a dispute in the family. In an Instagram post, local police explained that at the time of the shooting, other family members, including two adults and two children, were living in the house as guests. After discovering the bodies, one of them rushed out looking for help. He found someone who then called up 911. The police have not revealed the identity of the guests. Although the police have not given any details about the motive behind the shooting, they have stated that there is no immediate threat to the community and that the deaths directly affect their family friends and co-workers. They have also said that investigations had revealed that at the time of the gun being fired, no outsider had entered the house. This is being interpreted by many that a family dispute may be behind the deaths. Chandrasekhar worked for the Iowa department of public safety’s technology services bureau. Sources added that Lavanya too was a software developer. Friends and acquaintances cited his work excellence certificates claiming that he was hard working employee. TANA members got in touch with family members in Tsundur town and were told that everyone was in a state of shock. They also rejected any help saying that they did not want any attention. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jagan promises to provide corruption-fre.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy on Tuesday said he would ensure corruption-free government in the state. Responding to the motion of thanks to the governor in the assembly, the chief minister said he has set the tone for welfare-oriented and corruption-free government. The government would keep the promises made by him during in the  campaign. He said he would treat the YSRC manifesto as a holy book and would not ignore any promise made in that. He said the nation would look at Andhra Pradesh for its governance and welfare programmes. The social engineering in the cabinet formation where the SCs, STs, BCs, and minorities were given major share has already won the nation’s attention. He said welfare initiatives he was rolling out, too, were drawing the attention of people. Jaganmohan Reddy said he had advanced Rythu Bharosa by one year and it would be implemented from October 15. The government would also create a market stabilisation fund with Rs 3,000 crore to protect farmers, he said. The chief minister said he had proposed a judicial commission to clear tenders to prevent corruption. This is for the first time that the government is giving its powers to the judicial commission, he said. On welfare issues, the chief minister said that “Amma Vodi” programme would be launched from January 26, giving Rs 15,000 to every mother who sends her children to the school. The illiteracy in the state would be brought down to zero level in the next five years, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Woman donates Rs 7cr-land to CM.description: VIJAYAWADA: An elderly woman donated land worth Rs 7 crore to chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy on Tuesday. The woman, Padala Kasturi, hailing from West Godavari district, met the chief minister at the secretariat. Kasturi resides with her family in London and came down from UK to meet the new chief minister. Kasturi had first approached housing minister Cherukuvada Sriranganath Raju and told him about her intentions. Raju then sought out the CM’s appointment and Kasturi handed over the land documents to Jagan personally on Tuesday. She requested the chief minister to make use of the land to provide houses to the poor in the state. Jagan appreciated the gesture and assured that he would make good use of the land. The one acre land is situated at Natta Raameshwaram village, a prominent pilgrimage centre in West Godavari district. Kasturi made the donation as a tribute to her deceased son Padala Kankireddy. Other YSRC leaders were present during the meeting. Jagan felicitated Kasturi on the occasion. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

YSRC, TDP trade charges over corruption.description: VIJAYAWADA: YSRC and TDP members traded charges against each other on core issues of development, welfare and corruption in the assembly on Monday. The debate on the motion of thanks to the governor’s speech seems to have given enough opportunity for YSRC to blame the previous government for neglecting welfare. YSRC MLAs G Srikanth Reddy, Kakani Govardhan Reddy, Ambati Rambabu, R K Roja and Jogi Ramesh blamed the TDP for indulging in heavy corruption and resorting to wasteful expenditure. They blamed TDP for not fulfilling the promise of loan waiver for farmers. They alleged corruption in Polavaram project, Amaravati land pooling and other issues. TDP MLAs K Atchannaidu and Gorantla Butchaiah Chowdary dared YSRC to prove their allegations. “You have been making these allegations for the fast five years sitting in the opposition. Now, sitting in the treasury benches, you are making the same allegations. If you are serious on this, who is stopping you from ordering probe and coming up with facts?” Atchannaidu asked. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Truck mows down 2 farmers.description: TIRUPATI: Two farmers were killed while another sustained severe injuries in a road accident near C Mallavaram village along the Naidupet-Puthalapattu highway near Tirupati on Tuesday. According to police, three farmers Bathaiah, Kasthuraiah and Ramanarayana Reddy were returning to their village in a tractor which ran out of diesel near C Mallavaram village. They parked the tractor on the roadside, and walked in search of a fuel station when a speeding truck mowed them over. Bathaiah and Kasthuraiah, both died on the spot while Ramanarayana Reddy was rushed to the hospital where his condition is said to be critical. A case has been registered and further investigation is on. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Eminent doctor passes away in Tirupati.description: TIRUPATI: Dr B Govinda Narayana, resident medical officer at Sri Venkateswara Institute of Medical Sciences (SVIMS) passed away on Sunday night after suffering a heart attack while undergoing treatment at the superspecialty hospital in Tirupati. A condolence meeting was held at SVIMS on Monday. Director cum vice-chancellor, Fellow doctors commemorated the services rendered by Dr Narayana who joined the institution in 2000 as a resident medical officer and served for 19 long years.tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Villagers block truck carrying sand.description: VIJAYAWADA: Villagers staged a protest by blocking the path of a truck carrying sand from Muneru rivulet in Kanchela village under Nandigama mandal in Krishna district on Monday. According to police sources, the incident happened in the morning, when locals spread the word after they found a few people filling up the truck with sand from the dried path in the rivulet. Soon, they stopped the vehicle before it could flee the spot and said that they would not allow the sand to leave the village. Thereafter, the truck driver contacted the builder involved in the mining. The builder then approached the villagers and explained that they have taken requisite permissions from the district collector’s office through AP Builder’s Association to extract the sand. Regardless of the permission, the villagers refused to let them go of the truck and stated that the villagers too are stakeholders in the matter. Eventually, the truck had to be abandoned at the spot while the builders association will once again approach the district collector’s office for a smooth resolution of the matter. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Retailers continue to flout court order.description: Vijayawada: Even though the Supreme Court and the state consumer forum had issued orders against the sale of branded plastic bags, the practice goes on unabated across Vijayawada. From supermarkets to major wholesale dealers, vendors have been charging between Rs 10 and Rs 25 for branded plastic or cloth bags. According to the judgement of the consumer forum last year, plastic bags can be sold only if they are not branded. The local municipal body was empowered to implement the order. The body was given the authority to impose fines ranging from Rs 9,000 to Rs 18,000. “Recently, one of the Decathelon showrooms in Hyderabad was fined for selling branded carry bags. Prior to that, a Bata showroom in Chandigarh was held for contempt of court for a similar issue,” said Harish Shekhawat, a city-based consumer activist. Officials of the Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) said that they are first focussing on weeding out harmful plastic bags and will subsequently focus on the issue. Shekhawat further said that consumers blindly shell out money for carry bags exhibiting the brand name, without the awareness that the brand logo entitles them to get it for free. Many major retailers continue to violate the law as they would rather be fined once than lose a major source of income from customers. In their defence, retailers say that manufacturing these bags cost much more than disposable bags and they have already laid out a suggestive notice to bring their own bags. The public can keep the bill where they have been charged for branded carry bags and lodge a complaint through the Meekosam mobile application. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Naidu frisking: Senior cop backs airport.description: VIJAYAWADA: After the frisking of former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu at Gannavaram airport sparked a war of words between TDP and YSRC leaders, a senior police officer has come out in support of the security personnel at the airport. E Damodar, an inspector general (IG) rank official, who works as controller of legal metrology, issued a statement that everyone has to undergo security check other than those who were exempted by Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) at all airports in the country. He said having worked as an SP and overlooked VIP security for 3.5 years in undivided Andhra Pradesh, he wanted to clarify the rules on Aviation Security (AVSEC). The Standards and Recommended Practices (SARPS) of Chicago Convention of International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) mandate adherence to the SARPS by all member states. India, as part of ICAO needs to conform to SARPS. BCAS has also laid down categories of persons exempted from security screening and former chief ministers, even with Z category security, have not been exempted. Damodar said it was the late Jayalalithaa, former Tamil Nadu chief minister, who took up the issue with civil aviation authorities and secured exemption after she was subjected to security screening once she stepped down as chief minister. Andhra Pradesh becomes first in India to.description: VIJAYAWADA: The Andhra Pradesh police department has become the first in the country to give weekly offs to its personnel. From Wednesday itself, all personnel from constable to inspector ranks will start getting offs. Director general of police (DGP) Gautam Sawang ordered this after a meeting with the committee constituted to formulate guidelines on weekly offs. This comes in spite of the fact that the police department is facing a severe staff crunch. There is about 20% staff shortage in the department. The committee, headed by additional director general of police Ravishankar Ayyannar, gave its report with 19 alternative plans that will fit various units like intelligence, CID, SPF and greyhounds. The unit heads can choose any plan depending upon their convenience, said Ayyannar. While some states have earlier tried to implement weekly offs, they have been limited to pilot projects only. With implementation of weekly offs, cumulative staff crunch in the department will be 30 per cent as one-seventh of the staff will be off duties. Ayyannar went on to say that an IT dashboard will be created to monitor the weekly offs in all districts and special units from the DGP’s office. The system will be reviewed after a month to deal with the problems that arise in implementation. Police officers’ associations across the state welcomed the decision. Srinivasa Rao, president of Andhra Pradesh police officers’ association thanked chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy and the DGP for implementing the weekly offs. He said that they have been waiting for this for two decades. Jaganmohan Reddy had made weekly offs to police personnel a part of his election promises. 2 girls suffer injuries in leopard attac.description: TIRUPATI: Two young girls suffered injuries when a leopard attacked them on the second ghat road leading to Tirumala on Sunday night. 13-year-old Pavani and 21-year-old Yamini, both residents of Balaji nagar in Tirumala were returning home from Tirupati accompanied by their respective fathers on two two-wheelers when a leopard pounced upon them near the 16th kilometre turn along the second ghat road. According to the victims, the leopard attacked both the vehicles simultaneously when they fell. Following the fall, the leopard attempted to drag the girls away. In a bid to save their daughters, the fathers tried to scare off the wild cat. One of the fathers found a log and somehow managed to scare the leopard away. The girls sustained minor injuries on their legs and were rushed to Ashwini Hospital at Tirumala for treatment. The girls have been placed under observation for 24 hours. Locals and devotees in the area are scared out of their wits following the midnight leopard attack. Some locals said that forest department officials of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) have done little to prevent leopard attacks. “Even though a leopard was spotted near Mokalla Mettu on May 8, which is close to where the incident occurred on Sunday, the forest department has done nothing to capture the wild cat,” said a resident of Tirumala on condition of anonymity. Meanwhile, the forest department has not been able to confirm whether the leopard who attacked the goals was the same as the one spotted near Mokkala Mettu earlier. Instead of initiating measures, the forest officials are advising locals against venturing into the twin ghat roads in two-wheelers, especially at night. AP assembly passes unanimous resolution.description: VIJAYAWADA: The AP assembly unanimously passed a resolution on Tuesday, seeking special category status for the state. The House appealed to the NDA government at the Centre to grant SCS to the state at the earliest to overcome the financial crisis following its bifurcation. Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy moved the resolution, giving some background on the bifurcation of the state, distribution of assets and liabilities, and the promises made to the state by the Parliament as a precondition to the bifurcation and the constitutional binding of the government to fulfil the bifurcation promises, including the SCS. He sought to blame the previous TDP government for not pursuing the issue in 2014, till the Planning Commission was replaced with Niti Aayog. “The SCS promise was made to the state on the floor of Rajya Sabha and the same was ratified by the cabinet, which was again sent to the Planning Commission for implementation. However, the TDP government, instead of asking the Planning Commission to implement it, asked the central government, which brought the issue back to the table of the Union council of ministers,” the CM said. Jagan further said that the bifurcation was unjust, as distribution of assets and liabilities was not done in proportion. He also emphasised on the need to develop the state, which can be achieved if it gets SCS. “The grant of special category status will help the state get special industrial incentives such as income tax exemption, exemptions pertaining to GST, besides other concessions. The assembly reiterates that such special incentives are vital for our agrarian state, as it would enable rapid industrialisation, which would lead to improved employment opportunities for the youth and overall development of the state,” the resolution stated, adding that “the assembly expresses its firm opinion that there are no impediments whatsoever to conferring SCS on Andhra Pradesh”. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil.
